contentBlocks.title: General Requirements
paragraphs: Sole-occupancy units must collectively achieve an average energy rating of not less than 7 stars (including separate heating/cooling load limits).
Sole-occupancy units must individually achieve an energy rating of not less than 6 stars (including separate heating/cooling load limits).
Compliance required with J3D5 and J3D6 for thermal breaks.
Compliance required with Table J3D7w for compensating loss of ceiling insulation (if not handled by software).
Compliance required with J4D3 for general thermal construction.
Compliance required with J3D10(3), J3D10(5), and J3D10(6) for floor edge insulation.
Compliance required with Part J5 for building sealing.
Energy ratings must be achieved using accredited house energy rating software and ABCB Standard load limits.

contentBlocks.title: Roof Thermal Breaks (J3D5)
paragraphs: Roofs with metal sheet roofing fixed directly to metal purlins/rafters/battens (with no ceiling lining or lining fixed directly) must have a thermal break (≥ R0.2) installed between roofing and support.
Does not apply to roofs constructed using insulated sandwich panels.

contentBlocks.title: Wall Thermal Breaks (J3D6)
paragraphs: Metal-framed envelope walls clad with weatherboards, fibre-cement, metal sheeting etc. (with no wall lining or lining fixed directly to the same frame) must have a thermal break (≥ R0.2) installed at all points of contact between cladding and frame.
Does not apply to walls constructed using insulated sandwich panels.

contentBlocks.title: Thermal Construction General (J4D3)
paragraphs: Insulation must comply with AS/NZS 4859.1 and be installed continuously, abutting/overlapping, and without affecting services.
Reflective insulation requires necessary airspace, close fitting, adequate support, and proper joining (overlap or tape).
Bulk insulation must maintain position/thickness and overlap walls where necessary.
Thermal properties are deemed per Specification 36.
Calculation of Total R-Value/U-Value must follow specified methods (AS/NZS 4859.2, Spec 37, Spec 39, CIBSE Guide A).

contentBlocks.title: Floors - Specifics (J3D10)
paragraphs: Concrete slab-on-ground with in-slab/in-screed heating/cooling requires R1.0 vertical edge insulation.
Required edge insulation must be water-resistant and continuous to specified depth.
Requirement for edge insulation does not apply to in-screed systems solely in bathrooms/amenity areas.

contentBlocks.title: Minimum R-Value of ceiling insulation required to satisfy J3D7(1) and J3D7(3)
Climate Zone Specific Requirements
paragraphs: J5D4: Roof lights serving a habitable room must be sealed.
J5D5: Doors/openable windows must be sealed.
J5D6: Exhaust fans serving a habitable room need a sealing device.
J5D7: Ceilings/walls/floors/openings must be constructed to minimise air leakage.
J5D8: Evaporative coolers must be fitted with a self-closing damper.

contentBlocks.title: Evaporative Cooler Exemption
contentBlocks.text: Part J5 (Building Sealing) does NOT apply if the only air-conditioning is an evaporative cooler.

contentBlocks.title: Conditioned Space Entrance Requirements
contentBlocks.text: J5D5(4): Entrance leading to a conditioned space requires an airlock, self-closing door, rapid roller door, or revolving door (unless it's a café/restaurant/shop meeting specific zone criteria).
